sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K658008
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:description: position 3&5 mutated promoter lux pR-3/5 (luxR & HSL regulated)
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Yidan Hu
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: The position 3&5 mutated promoter lux pR-3/5 is a product of site-directed mutagenesis of promoter lux pR (BBa_R0062). The promoter lux pR is based on the Vibrio fischeri quorum sensing gene promoters. The position 5 mutated promoter lux pR-3/5 gives a lower expression of downstream genes in an autoinduction system. In another word, the lux pR-3/5 has a lower efficiency than the lux pR(BBa_R0062). Similar to promoter lux pR, the expression is up-regulated by the action of LuxR protein combined with the signal molecule HSL.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: We have generated two point mutants by site-directed mutagenesis from the sequence of lux pR(BBa_R0062). In these mutants, the G residue of position 5 was changed to a C and the C residue of position 3 was changed to a T respectively.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: The promoter lux pR (BBa_R0062).

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: lux pR-5
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:description: position 5 mutated promoter lux pR-5 (luxR & HSL regulated)
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Yidan Hu
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: The position 5 mutated promoter lux pR-5 is a product of site-directed mutagenesis of promoter lux pR (BBa_R0062). The promoter lux pR is based on the Vibrio fischeri quorum sensing gene promoters. The position 5 mutated promoter lux pR-5 gives a higher expression of downstream genes in an autoinduction system. In another word, the lux pR-5 has a higher efficiency than the lux pR. Similar to promoter lux pR, the expression is up-regulated by the action of LuxR protein combined with the signal molecule HSL.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: By PCR method the G residue of position 5 was changed to a C based on the sequence of the promoter lux pR(BBa_R0062).
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: The promoter lux pR (BBa_R0062).

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_I751502
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Kenichiro Iwasaki
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: sense TWO INPUTS, activation by AHL and repression by LacI.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: Compared with existing BioBrick hybrid promoter R0065, this promoter is different in that its sequence is much shorter with lux box and -35 region overlapping, and that it is repressed by LacI, not cI. Also, the output is clearly detected as shown in Fig. 3.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K1520010
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: yue wu
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: Prlux-rbs-rfp-Ter. It produces rfp when there is enough luxR and AHL.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: None
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: Prlux, rfp, Ter

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_J64712
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: laura lavery
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: This part is similar to BBa_R0079 but has an added binding site for RHLR/RHLI in between the -35 and -10 region. Thus this promoter is induced by LasR/LasI but repressed by RHLR/RHLI binding.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: The natural spacer between the -35 and -10 is 14bp and the natural O1 site for RHLR/RHLI is 20bp long. There was not much over lap of the -35 or the -10 with this sequence, so it was nessicary to chop off some of the binding site sequence in order to maintain the correct spacing and preserve the -35 and -10 sequence. The binding site sequence is missing a tcc on is 5' end and a t on its 3' end.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: Rust L. et. al., "Analysis of the Pseudomonas aeruginosa Elastase (lasB) Regulatory Region". Journal of Bacteriology, 1996.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: Lux
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Vinay S Mahajan, Voichita D. Marinescu, Brian Chow, Alexander D Wissner-Gross and Peter Carr
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: The lux cassette of V. fischeri contains a left and a right promoter. The right promoter gives weak constitutive expression of downstream genes.This expression is up-regulated by the action of the Lux repressor, LuxR. Two molecules of LuxR protein form a complex with two molecules the signalling compound homoserine lactone (HSL). This complex binds to a palindromic site on the promoter, increasing the rate of transcription.In thisversion, a binding site for cI dimer has been added: binding to this site dominantly represses transcription.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: V. fishceri and phage lambda (courtesy of Ron Weiss)

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_J64067
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Jeffrey J Tabor
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: The -35 box of R0065 has been modified to promote constitutive (LuxR+3OC6HSL-independent) gene expression. An extended -10 sequence has also been added to increase absolute transcription. The promoter still contains the operators OR1 and OR2 such that it retains its sensitivity to CI.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: see above
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: modified from R0065

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: luxR
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Srini Devadas, David Gray, Ronny Krashinsky, Debra Lin, and Chris Zheng Liu
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: This part involves the -10 binding site, the -35 binding site, and the twenty nucleotides between that constitute the lux box. With this part, LuxR functions as a acyl-homoserine lactone-dependent repressor. LuxR resonds to the HSL produced by LuxI, N-(3-oxohexanoyl)-HSL. The Lux box is positioned such that it partially overlaps the consensus -35 and -10 hexamers of an RNA polymerase binding site.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K266007
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: UNAM FCIENCIAS-CINVESTAV IRA
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: Complex Quorum sensing circuit that receives the signal of PAI+LasR and AI+LuxR to control the production of LuxI and LasI enzymes.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: None
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: The biobricks BBa_K266006 and BBa_K266000 where used to build this biobrick

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K145150
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:description: Hybrid promoter: HSL-LuxR activated, P22 C2 repressed
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Jonas Demeulemeester
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: Hybrid promoter consisting of the Lux box which overlaps partly with -35 box. Binding sites for P22 C2 O<sub>R2</sub> and O<sub>R1</sub> are located between the -35 and -10 boxes and downstream of them respectively.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: -35 box is partly composite. -10 is taken from the P22 phage P<sub>R</sub> regulatory region
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: Synthetic

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K1520515
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: yue wu
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: MC7-rbs-luxI-Ter-Pcons2-rbs-luxR-Ter-Prlux-rbs-OMPA-golB-rbs-luxI-Ter. It is a test of our positive feedback circuit for microcystin.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: None
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: MC7, luxI, Pcons2, luxR, Prlux, OMPA-golB, Ter

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_I751501
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Kenichiro Iwasaki
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: sense TWO INPUTS, activation by AHL and repression by LacI.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes:
Based on the AHL regulated BioBrick part R0062 and the previous work on LacI regulated promoter (ref. 1), we designed a new promoter regulated by AHL and LacI. Since this promoter is a kind of a "HYBRID" of the two, we call it HYBRID PROMOTER.
Compared with existing BioBrick hybrid promoter R0065, this promoter is different in that its sequence is much shorter with lux box and -35 region overlapping, and that it is repressed by LacI, not cI. Also, the output is clearly detected as shown in Fig. 3.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_I739105
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Stefan Luzi
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: asd
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: asdf
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: Synthetic DNA

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_J102001
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Michael Pettigrew
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: This promoter is the right promoter in the lux cassette of Vibrio Fischeri. There is weak constitutive expression of downstream genes. Expression of downstream genes can be up-regulated by the action of the LuxR activator protein in complex with the autoinducer, 3-oxo-hexanoyl-HSL. Two molecules of LuxR protein can form a complex with two molecules of the AHL. This causes a conformational change in the protein, allowing it to bind to a site on the lux promoter and induce transcription.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: None.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: This part was obtained by taking the reverse complement of R0062, ordering appropriate oligos, then annealing and extending them.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K091157
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Erin Feeney
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: K091157 is a modified version of the pLux' promoter (BBa_K091156) containing the addition of a LasR binding site between the -35 and -10 regions. This promoter is expected to be activated in the presence of AI-1 and LuxR and repressed in the presence of PAI-1 and LasR.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: In order to fit the LasR binding site between the -35 and -10 regions, the last base of the Las Box was cropped and the -35 region was modified to overlap with the first two bases of the Las Box.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: The LasR binding site is from the region upstream of the LasI gene in Pseudomonas aeruginosa. The rest of the promoter is the same as BBa_K091156.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: lux pR
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Vinay S Mahajan, Voichita D. Marinescu, Brian Chow, Alexander D Wissner-Gross and Peter Carr
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription:
Promoter activated by LuxR in concert with HSL

The lux cassette of V. fischeri contains a left and a right promoter. The right promoter gives weak constitutive expression of downstream genes.This expression is up-regulated by the action of the LuxR activator protein complexed with the autoinducer, 3-oxo-hexanoyl-HSL. Two molecules of LuxR protein form a complex with two molecules of the signalling compound homoserine lactone (HSL). This complex binds to a palindromic site on the promoter, increasing the rate of transcription.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: This promoter is based on the Vibrio fischeri quorum sensing gene promoters. Two genes LuxI and LuxR and transcribed in opposite directions as shown below. The original sequence from which the parts BBa_R0062 and BBa_R0063 were derived is shown in the picture below.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: V. fischeri

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K266006
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: UNAM FCIENCIAS-CINVESTAV IRA
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: BBa_K091146 promoter (PAI+LasR inducible & AI+LuxR repressible) controls the policistronic expresion of LasI enzyme and GFP, double terminator
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: None.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: The biobricks BBa_K266005 and BBa_E0840 where used to build this biobrick.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: lux pR
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:description: Promoter, Standard (luxR and HSL regulated -- lux pR)
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator:
Vinay S Mahajan, Voichita D. Marinescu, Brian Chow, Alexander D Wissner-Gross and Peter Carr
Drew Endy
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription:
[Note: This is the same part as R0062 except that the -10 and -35 sites and spacing have been changed to comply with BBa_S0001].

Promoter activated by LuxR in concert with HSL

The lux cassette of V. fischeri contains a left and a right promoter. The right promoter gives weak constitutive expression of downstream genes.This expression is up-regulated by the action of the LuxR activator protein complexed with the autoinducer, 3-oxo-hexanoyl-HSL. Two molecules of LuxR protein form a complex with two molecules of the signalling compound homoserine lactone (HSL). This complex binds to a palindromic site on the promoter, increasing the rate of transcription.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes:
This promoter is based on the Vibrio fischeri quorum sensing gene promoters. Two genes LuxI and LuxR and transcribed in opposite directions as shown below. The original sequence from which the parts BBa_R0062 and BBa_R0063 were derived is shown in the picture below.



Modified to comply with BBa_S0001:
TTGACA-17N-GATACT
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: V. fischeri

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K266005
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: UNAM FCIENCIAS-CINVESTAV IRA
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: BBa_K091146 promoter (PAI+LasR inducible & AI+LuxR repressible) controls the expresion of LasI enzyme, no terminator
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: None
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: The biobricks BBa_K091146 and BBa_S03154 where used to build this biobrick

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K091107
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Xiao Zhu
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: This hybrid promoter is designed to respond to activation by LuxR when it is bound to AHL and to repression by the phage lambda cI repressor. The repression needs to win over activation.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: This part is based on the idea of replacing the region of the Lux promoter downstream of the -35 with the OR2 cI half-operator, added LuxR-10 region. Based on what we have found up to now, promoters which are constructed just by inserting OR1/2 downstream of Lux are all very leaky.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: this part comes from LuxR promoter and cI lambda promoter.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K1520516
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: yue wu
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: MC31-rbs-luxI-Ter-Pcons2-rbs-luxR-Ter-Prlux-rbs-OMPA-golB-rbs-luxI-Ter It is a test of our positive feedback circuit for microcystin.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: None
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: MC31, luxI, Pcons2, luxR, Prlux, OMPA-golB, Ter

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: lux pR-3
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:description: position 3 mutated promoter lux pR-3 (luxR & HSL regulated)
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Yidan Hu
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: The position 3 mutated promoter lux pR-3 is a product of site-directed mutagenesis of promoter lux pR (BBa_R0062). The promoter lux pR is based on the Vibrio fischeri quorum sensing gene promoters. The position 3 mutated promoter lux pR-3 gives a higher expression of downstream genes in an autoinduction system. In another word, the lux pR-3 has a higher efficiency than the lux pR. Similar to promoter lux pR, the expression is up-regulated by the action of LuxR protein combined with the signal molecule HSL.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: In the promoter lux pR's sequence, the C residue of position 3 was changed to a T using PCR method.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: The position 3 mutated promoter lux pR-3 is based on promoter lux pR (BBa_R0062).

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: lux pL
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Vinay S Mahajan, Voichita D. Marinescu, Brian Chow, Alexander D Wissner-Gross and Peter Carr
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: The lux cassette of V. fischeri contains a left and a right promoter. The left promoter gives weak constitutive expression of downstream genes.This expression is down-regulated by the action of the Lux repressor, LuxR. Two molecules of LuxR protein form a complex with two molecules the signalling compound homoserine lactone (HSL). This complex binds to a palindromic site on the promoter, increasing the rate of transcription from Pr, repressing transcription from Pl
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes:
This promoter is based on the Vibrio fischeri quorum sensing gene promoters. Two genes LuxI and LuxR and transcribed in opposite directions as shown below. The original sequence from which the parts BBa_R0062 and BBa_R0063 were derived is shown in the picture below.Includes most of Lux reulatory region, including the LuxR binding site which activates the right promoter. A putative LuxR autorepression binding site is also identified adjacent to the -10 site of the right promoter. This 2nd site has 55% identity with the first site. Putative inverted repeats (of size 18-27 bp) also exist between these two sites (not marked above), which may represent binding sites for other regulatory proteins.

Unspecified.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: V. fischeri.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K091156
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Erin Feeney
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: The pLux' promoter is a modified version of BBa_R0062 containing the -35 region TTTAAT in place of TTTACG. Transcriptional activation is expected to occur in the presence of LuxR and AI-1, just as with R0062. The modified -35 region was designed to serve as a control for the evaluation of BBa_K091156, the pLux+ Las- promoter.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: This promoter is identical to pLux+ Las- with the exception of the Las box's absence
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: This part was adapted from BBa_R0062.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K091146
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Erin Feeney
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: K091146 is a modified version of the pLas' promoter (BBa_K091117) containing the addition of a luxR binding site between the -35 and -10 regions. This promoter is expected to be activated in the presence of PAI-1 and LasR and repressed in the presence of AI-1 and LuxR.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: The Lux box was placed adjacent to the LasR binding site with the aim of minimizing cross-talk in the presence of both PAI-1 and AI-1; since the LasR site should have a higher affinity, we hope that the binding of PAI-1 will competitively exclude the binding of AI-1.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: The LuxR binding site is from BBa_R0062 and the pLas' promoter is from the region upstream of the LasI gene in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
